New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first major league player to hit 50 home runs and steal 50 bases in a season.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit his 50th home run in the seventh inning, an opposite-field, two-run shot to left against Marlins reliever Mike Baumann.
Ohtani swiped his 50th base in the first and his 51st in the second.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts said before Thursday's game that he noticed Ohtani getting more aggressive on the bases in the second half of the season.
Ohtani was already the sixth player in major league history and the fastest ever to reach 40 home runs and 40 stolen bases in a season.
Post-Match Reflections: Ohtani has been successful on his last 28 stolen base attempts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani reached the milestone in his 150th game.
Ohtani's previous career high in homers was 46 for the Los Angeles Angels in 2021.
Others: Ohtani has not pitched this season while recovering from elbow surgery, allowing him to focus his attention on batting and baserunning as the Dodgers' everyday designated hitter.
